meanings.definition: To adapt or alter for a different purpose or use.
meanings.sent1: She retooled the old bicycle into a flower pot stand.
meanings.sent2: The company retooled their marketing strategy to reach a wider audience.
meanings.sent3: He retooled the broken toy car into a quirky pencil holder.
meanings.sent4: The chef retooled the traditional recipe with a modern twist.
meanings.sent5: The artist retooled the painting, adding vibrant colors and new details.

meanings.definition: To make changes or improvements to something.
meanings.sent1: They retooled the website for better user experience.
meanings.sent2: After feedback, the team retooled the design of the product.
meanings.sent3: The students retooled their project presentation with funny animations.
meanings.sent4: She retooled her resume to highlight new skills.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic retooled the engine, making it run more efficiently.
